profile.profileDescription: A profile for a LAM system in Vancouver, Canada

label.name_singular: Sinti and Roma culture and customs
label.name_plural: Sinti and Roma culture and customs

label.name_singular: Destruction of cultural and religious sites and objects
label.name_plural: Destruction of cultural and religious sites and objects

label.name_singular: Peter Suedfeld UBC (VanCity/Hampton Fund Research Grant)
label.name_plural: Peter Suedfeld UBC (VanCity/Hampton Fund Research Grant)

label.name: Alternate identifiers
label.description: Any additional unambiguous reference to the resource within a given context.

label.name: Caption
label.description: Short descriptive caption for item.

label.name: Notes (internal use only)
label.description: Notes regarding item

label.name: GeoNames
label.description: A Geographic lookup that takes search text, passes it to the GeoNames search service and provides a dropdown with search results (ordered by score). Selected geoname is stored as both text (name, country, continent and ID) and the service URL identifier.

label.name: Creation Date (Display)
label.description: A concise description of the date or range of dates associated with the creation, design, production, presentation, performance, construction, or alteration of the work or its components, presented in a syntax suitable for display to the end-user and including any necessary indications of uncertainty, ambiguity, and nuance.

label.name: Subject - Personal Name
label.description:
Significant names represented in or by the resource (personal, corporate, family, meeting, etc.) Example: Petrarca, Francesco, 1304-1374
American Philosophical Society

label.name: Subject - Topic
label.description:
What the resource described in the record is about, depicts, or expresses. Example: Clothing & dress [TGM]
Correspondence [LCSH]

label.name: Subject - Geographic
label.description:
Significant names of geographic locations represented in or by the resource. Example: North America
Claremont (Calif.)
Rocky Mountains

label.name: Genre
label.description:
Cultural category of the original object. Advertisements Ephemera Albums Interviews Blank Forms Diaries Drawings Maps Posters etc.
Newspapers Trial Proceedings Periodicals

label.name: Language
label.description: The language or languages of the content of the resource. Example: English German Yiddish

label.name: Georeference
label.description: Coordinates documenting the location of the item

label.name: Reason/Context for Deaccession
label.description: Explantion as to why the object was deaccessioned from the collection. (VHEC)

label.name: Contact Information
label.description: The institution or the individual who received the object upon deaccesion (if applicable). (VHEC)

label.name: Location
label.description: Post-deaccession location of the object. (VHEC)

label.name: Value
label.description: The deaccession value, in Canadian dollars, of the object. (VHEC)

label.name: Documentation
label.description: Documentation pertaining to the deaccession. (VHEC)

label.name: Object/Work Type
label.description: Local list of genre terms applied across the VHEC's collections. Example: Correspondence, testimony, religious materials.

label.name: Display Creator
label.description: The name and roles (if necessary) of the named creator or creators in the design and production of the work. Example: primary painter was Dai Xi (Chinese, 1801-1860), with additional inscriptions and colophons added by other officials; commissioned by Wu Zhongzhun

label.name: Source title
label.description: The source for the title, generally a published source.

label.name: Display Measurements
label.description: Information about the dimensions, size, or scale of the work, presented in a syntax suitable for display to the end-user and including any necessary indications of uncertainty, ambiguity, and nuance. It may include the scale of the work. It may also include the number of the parts of a complex work, series, or collection. Example: 61.6 x 97.2 cm (24 1/4 x 38 1/4 inches) (oval); scale: 1 inch = 10 feet

label.name: Indexing Measurements
label.description: The dimensions or other measurements for one aspect of a work (e.g., width); may be combined with extent, qualifier, and other sub-elements as necessary. Use the metric system.

label.name: Height
label.description: Height of Object (CA)

label.name: Width
label.description: Width of Object (CA)

label.name: Depth
label.description: Depth of Object (CA)

label.name: Diameter
label.description: Diameter of Object (CA)

label.name: Weight
label.description: Weight of Object (CA)

label.name: Dimensions Extent
label.description: An explanation of the part of the work being measured, included when necessary for clarity. Example: Components, object with base. (CDWA)

label.name: Dimension Notes
label.description: Additional descriptive notes relating to the indexing measurement. (VHEC)

label.name: Display Materials/Techniques
label.description: An indication of the substances or materials used in the creation of a work, as well as any implements, production or manufacturing techniques, processes, or methods incorporated in its fabrication, presented in a syntax suitable for display to the end-user and including any necessary indications of uncertainty, ambiguity, and nuance.

label.name: Indexing Materials/Techniques Set
label.description: Materials and techniques indexed with controlled terms for retrieval; if multiple parts of the work require separate materials and techniques, or if you are recording media and support separately, repeat this element with the type attribute and/or the extent sub-element.

label.name: Display State/Edition
label.description:
A description of the state of the work; used primarily for prints and other multiples. Or description of the edition of the work; used primarily for prints and other multiples. Example: State: 1st of 3 states (Robison (1986))
State: 2ndstate; Edition: 7/50

label.name: Source display state/edition
label.description: The published source of the state or edition information.

label.name: Style
label.description:
Term that identifies the named, defined style, historical or artistic period, movement, group, or school whose characteristics are represented in the work being catalogued. Example: Renaissance
Baroque; Louis XIV

label.name: Culture
label.description: Name of the culture, people, or nationality from which the work originated. Example: Culture: Etruscan Cultures: Netherlandish; French

label.name: Repository
label.description:
The name and geographic location of the repository that is currently responsible for the work, or, for monumental works and architecture, the geographic location of the work. Example: Vancouver Holocaust Education Centre
J. Paul Getty Museum (Los Angeles, California)

label.name: Inscriptions
label.description: A description or transcription of any distinguishing or identifying physical lettering, annotations, texts, markings, or labels that are affixed, applied, stamped, written, inscribed, or attached to the work, excluding any mark or text inherent in the materials of which the work is made. Example: Inscribed on the front: MEA SORTE CONTENTUS; signed on the left: R. Verhulst fec.; dated on the right: Anno 1671; inscribed on the back: DIT IS HET AFBEELTSEL VAN / IACOB VAN BERGH .

label.name: Rights for Work
label.description: Information about rights management; may include copyright and other intellectual property statements required for use regarding the work. If the holder of the reproduction rights to the image/resource differs from the rights for the work, use rightsResource. Example: © J. Paul Getty Museum

label.name: Link Resource
label.description: A uri/url reference that is universal and in the worldwide web environment.

label.name: Resource Type
label.description: The generic identification of the medium of the image or other resource.

label.name: Resource View Description
label.description: A description of the spatial, chronological, or contextual aspects of the work as captured in the view of this particular image or other resource.

label.name: Resource View Type
label.description: The specific vantage point or perspective of the view.

label.name: Resource View Subject Term
label.description: Terms or phrases that characterize the subject matter of the work as it is depicted in a specific image or other resource.

label.name: Resource View Date
label.description: A date or range of dates associated with the creation or production of the image. This is not necessarily the same as the date of production of the resource (e.g., a print of a negative may be made years after the image was first captured on film). For the date of the resource, use Resource Date.

label.name: Resource Source
label.description: Identification of the agency, individual, repository, or publication from which the image or other resource was obtained, including a bibliographic citation in the case of copy photography.

label.name: Indexing Subject
label.description: Subject Indexing information about the work, group, collection, or series that is being catalogued. Example: landscape, hunters, dogs, autumn, sunset, Hudson River (New York, USA)

label.name: Classification
label.description: Term used to categorize a work by grouping it together with other works on the basis of similar characteristics, including materials, form, shape, function, region of origin, cultural context, or historical or stylistic era. Example: sculpture; Pre-Columbian art

label.name: Facture
label.description: Detailed discussion of the way in which the work was made, including an assessment of its workmanship or characteristics of execution, construction methods used, or the applications of techniques. Example: Ten feathers are bent through holes in the upper rim and sewn in place.

label.name: Orientation/Arrangement
label.description: An explanation of the way a work is meant to be seen or has been displayed. Example: hung horizontally

label.name: Collection/Creation History
label.description: The provenance or history of the owners of a work of art, architecture, or group from its creation to the present. This includes the means by which a work passed from one owner to the next, an identification of any public sales involving the work or the names of any agents who aided the transfer of ownership, and the names of any dealers who handled the work or included it in their inventories. If a work has been lost, stolen, or destroyed, or has otherwise vanished from public view, this fact should also be indicated here.

label.name: Provenance Description
label.description: The prose description of the provenance or history of the owners or others in possession of a work of art or architecture, or a group. (CDWA)

label.name: Transfer Mode
label.description: The means by which a work entered the collection of a particular individual or corporate body. (CDWA)

label.name: Note: Transfer Mode
label.description: Note describing the method of transfer. (VHEC)

label.name: Cost/Value (Indexing)
label.description: The monetary value of a work in a specific currency at the time of transfer of ownership. This can be either a purchase price or an evaluation. (CDWA)

label.name: Cost/Value (Display)
label.description: The monetary value of a work in a specific currency at the time of transfer of ownership presented in a syntax suitable for display. This can be either a purchase price or an evaluation. (Modified CDWA)

label.name: Legal Status
label.description: The legal status of the work. Example: public property. (CDWA)

label.name: Owner/Agent
label.description: The name of an individual or corporate body (institution, agency, or group) that owned or was in possession of the work of art or architecture, or served as an agent or intermediary in its transfer from one owner to another. (CDWA)

label.name: Ownership Place
label.description: The place where the work was housed while in the possession of a particular owner. Example: Amsterdam (Netherlands). (CDWA)

label.name: Ownership Date
label.description: The period of time during which the work belonged to or was in the possession of a particular owner or agent. (CDWA)

label.name: Owner's Numbers / Number Type
label.description: Any number and type assigned to a work by a specific owner or by an agent in its transfer of ownership. Example: Accession number, 1988.00017.0013. (CDWA)

label.name: Credit Line
label.description: A formal public statement about the ownership, transfer of ownership, acquisition, source, or sponsorship of the acquisition of a work, suitable for use in a display label or publication. Example: Samuel H. Kress Collection. (CDWA)

label.name: Anonymous Donation
label.description: Indicates whether the owner/agent of the work would like to remain anonymous from all crediting. (VHEC)

label.name: Administrative Notes
label.description: Additional notes or comments pertinent to information in this category. (CDWA)

label.name: Creation Place
label.description: The location where the creation, design, or production of the work or its components took place, or the original location of the work. Example: Soho (Manhattan, New York, United States)

label.name: Place Qualifier
label.description: Clarification of the significance of the place

label.name: Condition Report
label.description: Documentation pertaining to the condition of the object. (VHEC)

label.name: Report Date
label.description: Date of the condition report. (VHEC)

label.name: Condition Remarks
label.description: Descriptive note relating to the condition or condition documentation. (VHEC)

label.name: Object Sensitivity and Environmental Display Restrictions
label.description: Restrictions limiting the display or use of an object. Example: Object is made of pulp paper and is at high risk for rapid fading. (VHEC)

label.name: Lifetime Lux Hours
label.description: The maximum lux hours that the object can withstand in its display lifetime. (VHEC)

label.name: Display Period
label.description: Date range during which the object was displayed. (VHEC)

label.name: Lux Hours Used
label.description: Lux hours that pertain to the display period. (VHEC)

label.name: Temperature and Relative Humidity
label.description: Environmental notes that pertain to the display period. (VHEC)

label.name: Related Exhibition/Loan
label.description: Exhibtion or loan that relates to the display period. (VHEC)

label.name: Administrative Notes
label.description: Additional notes or comments pertinent to information in this category. (CA)

label.name: Type
label.description: An indication of the types of alternate texts associated with this obect. Example: Translation. (VHEC)

label.name: Descriptive Note
label.description: Note describing the alternate text type. (VHEC)

label.name: Document Upload
label.description: Document pertaining to the alternate text. (VHEC)

label.name: Administrative Note
label.description: Administrative notes or comments pertinent to information in this category. (Modified CDWA)

label.name: Examination
label.description: An assessment of the overall physical condition, characteristics, and completeness of a work of art or architecture at a particular time. This includes examinations of the work under special conditions, such as ultraviolet light, but excludes interventions or treatments that alter the condition of a work, such as restoration or conservation. Example: Very good condition. Small tears in the margins only.

label.name: Examination Assessment
label.description: An assessment of the overall physical condition, characteristics, and completeness of a work of art or architecture at a particular time. This includes examinations of the work under special conditions, such as ultraviolet light, but excludes interventions or treatments that alter the condition of a work, such as restoration or conservation. Example: Very good condition. Small tears in the margins only.

label.name: Examination Type
label.description: The kind of examination made of the work's condition. Example: visual examination

label.name: Examination Date
label.description: The latest date when an examination took place. Example: 12 December 1991

label.name: Examination Place
label.description: The location, studio, or laboratory where the examination of the work's condition took place. Example: Conservation Analytical Laboratory, Smithsonian Institution (Washington, DC, United States)

label.name: Examination Remarks
label.description: Additional notes or comments pertinent to information in this category.

label.name: Treatment Agent
label.description: The identification of the person who performed a specific conservation procedure, including his or her name, role or title, and institutional affiliation.

label.name: Examination
label.description: An assessment of the overall physical condition, characteristics, and completeness of a work of art or architecture at a particular time. This includes examinations of the work under special conditions, such as ultraviolet light, but excludes interventions or treatments that alter the condition of a work, such as restoration or conservation. Example: Very good condition. Small tears in the margins only.

label.name: Examination Type
label.description: The kind of examination made of the work's condition. Example: visual examination

label.name: Examination Date
label.description: The latest date when an examination took place. Example: 12 December 1991

label.name: Examination Place
label.description: The location, studio, or laboratory where the examination of the work's condition took place. Example: Conservation Analytical Laboratory, Smithsonian Institution (Washington, DC, United States)

label.name: Examination Notes
label.description: Additional notes or comments pertinent to information in this category.

label.name: Conservation Future
label.description: Recommendations for future conservation treatment of the object. Example: fumigate annually (CHIN)

label.name: Appraisal Date
label.description: The date on which the appraisal value was determined for the object(s). (CHIN)

label.name: Acquisition Date
label.description: Date the appraised object(s) were legally transferred to the VHEC. (VHEC)

label.name: Appraised Value
label.description: The appraised value, in Canadian dollars, of the object(s). (CHIN)

label.name: Insurance Value
label.description: The value, in Canadian dollars, of the object(s) as determined for insurance purposes. (CHIN)

label.name: Tax Receipt Issued
label.description: Indicates whether a tax receipt was issued to the contributor/donor. (VHEC)

label.name: Remarks
label.description: Remarks concerning the appraisal of the object(s). (CHIN)

label.name: Appraisal Documentation
label.description: Documentation pertaining to the appraisal. (VHEC)

label.name: Exhibition Type
label.description: An indication of the type of exhibition or loan. Example: Inhouse exhibition

label.name: Object/Work Label/Identification
label.description: The type of number assigned to a work in a specific exhibition. Example: accession number

label.name: Environmental Conditions
label.description: The temperature, light, humidity, and other environmental factors that characterized the exhibition space.

label.name: Environmental Remarks
label.description: Additional notes or comments pertinent to information in this category.

label.name: Loan Type
label.description: An indication of the type of loan.

label.name: Title Note
label.description: Record any notes about the title. Use for information about the source of the title (RAD 1.8B2), parallel titles and other title information (RAD 1.8B3), or any other title notes.

label.name: Title Note: Variations in Title
label.description: Variant title(s) or title(s) by which the unit has been previously known e.g. Previously known as Fonds Raoul Dandurand. Example: Previously known as Fonds Raoul Dandurand

label.name: Title Note: Source of Title Proper
label.description: Example: Title based on contents of image

label.name: Title Note: Parallel Titles and Other Title Information
label.description: Notes on parallel titles and other title information not recorded in the Title and statement of responsibility area.

label.name: Repository
label.description: Vancouver Holocaust Education Centre (VHEC). If the originals are located elsewhere, enter location in Original location field.

label.name: Place of Publication, Distribution, etc.
label.description: A place of publication, distribution, etc., in the form and the grammatical case in which it appears e.g. Köln.

label.name: Place, Name, and Date of Manufacture
label.description: Use for an object/artifact only: place and name of the manufacturer if that information is found on the item.

label.name: Extent and Medium
label.description: Record the extent of the unit of description by giving the number of physical or logical units in arabic numerals and the unit of measurement. Give the specific medium (media) of the unit of description. (ISAD(G) 3.1.5. See also RAD 1.5B-D and 4.5C3-3).

label.name: Publisher, Distributor, Producer, etc.
label.description: Record the place of publication, distribution or production followed by the name of the publisher, distributor, etc. If necessary, add one of the following terms to the name: distributor, production company, producer, or publisher. E.g. Montréal : National Film Board of Canada [production company]. (RAD 1.4C, D, E and F)”

label.name: Administrative/Biographical History
label.description: Record concisely any significant information on the origin, progress, development and work of the organization (or organizations) or on the life and work of the individual (or individuals) responsible for the creation of the unit of description. If additional information is available in a published source, cite the source. For persons or families record information such as full names and titles, dates of birth and death, place of birth, successive places of domicile, activities, occupation or offices, original and any other names, significant accomplishments, and place of death. For corporate bodies record information such as the official name, the dates of existence, enabling legislation, functions, purpose and development of the body, its administrative hierarchy, and earlier, variant or successive names. (ISAD(G) 3.2.2. See also RAD 1.7B)

label.name: Scope and Content
label.description: The sphere or kinds of activities that generated the records; the period of time and geographical area to which they pertain; their internal structure, including documentary forms; and the matters to which the records pertain.

label.name: Archival History
label.description: Record the successive transfers of ownership, responsibility and/or custody of the unit of description and indicate those actions, such as history of the arrangement, production of contemporary finding aids, re-use of the records for other purposes or software migrations, that have contributed to its present structure and arrangement. Give the dates of these actions, insofar as they can be ascertained. If the archival history is unknown, record that information. (ISAD(G) 3.2.3. See also RAD 1.7C)

label.name: Immediate Source of Acquisition or Transfer
label.description: Record the source from which the unit of description was acquired and the date and/or method of acquisition if any or all of this information is not confidential. If the source is unknown, record that information. (ISAD(G) 3.2.4. See also RAD 1.8B12)

label.name: Note: Physical Description
label.description: Notes on physical description that were not included in that field e.g. Includes: 40 cm of textual records, ca. 670 photographs, ca. 260 postcards, 4 watercolours. Example: Includes: 40 cm of textual records, ca. 670 photographs, ca. 260 postcards, 4 watercolours

label.name: Physical Characteristcs and Technical Requirements
label.description: Indicate any important physical conditions, such as preservation requirements, that affect the use of the unit of description. Note any software and/or hardware required to access the unit of description. (ISAD(G) 3.4.4. See also RAD 1.8B91)

label.name: Note: Accompanying Material
label.description: Details of accompanying material not mentioned in the Physical description area.

label.name: System of Arrangement
label.description: Specify the internal structure, order and/or the system of classification of the unit of description. Note how these have been treated by the archivist. For electronic records, record or reference information on system design. (ISAD(G) 3.3.4. See also RAD 1.8B13)

label.name: Language/Scripts of Material
label.description: Record the language(s) and/or script(s) of the materials comprising the unit of description. Note any distinctive alphabets, scripts, symbol systems or abbreviations employed. (ISAD(G) 3.4.3. See also RAD 1.8B14)

label.name: Existence and Location of Originals
label.description: If the original of the unit of description is available (either in the institution or elsewhere) record its location, together with any significant control numbers. If the originals no longer exist, or their location is unknown, give that information. (ISAD(G) 3.5.1. See also RAD 1.8B15)

label.name: Existence and Location of Copies
label.description: If the copy of the unit of description is available (either in the institution or elsewhere) record its location, together with any significant control numbers. (ISAD(G) 3.5.2. See also RAD 1.8B18)

label.name: Finding Aids
label.description: Give information about any finding aids that the repository or records creator may have that provide information relating to the context and contents of the unit of description. If appropriate, upload a copy. (ISAD(G) 3.4.5. See also RAD 1.8B17)

label.name: Related Units of Description
label.description: Associated material (1.8B18), Related groups of records in different fonds (1.8B20), Related groups of records within the same fonds (1.8B20a)

label.name: Accruals
label.description: Indicate if accruals are expected. Where appropriate, give an estimate of their quantity and frequency. (ISAD(G) 3.3.3. See also RAD 1.8B19)

label.name: Notes
label.description: Record specialized or other important information not accommodated by any of the defined elements of description. (ISAD(G) 3.6.1. See also RAD 1.8B)

label.name: Publication Note
label.description: Record a citation to, and/or information about a publication that is about or based on the use, study, or analysis of the unit of description. Include references to published facsimiles or transcriptions. (ISAD(G) 3.5.4)

label.name: Name of Publisher, Distributor, etc.
label.description: The name of the publisher, distributor, etc., following the place(s) to which it relates e.g. Vancouver : UBC Press. If place is unknown, use s.l.; if publisher is unknown, use s.n. Example: New York : RCA Victor

label.name: Statement of Responsibility
label.description: Transcribe only explicit statements of responsibility as they appear on the item. Example: Iron maiden [GMD]: aces high / by Derek Riggs. (RAD 1.1F)

label.name: Title Note: Attribution and Conjectures
label.description: Notes on authors to whom the unit being described has been attributed; cite sources, if appropriate.

label.name: Date Note
label.description: Use to record any notes on the date(s) of creation, publication, distribution, accumulation or collection. (RAD 1.8B8 and 1.8B8a)

label.name: Scope and Content
label.description: Give a summary of the scope (such as, time periods, geography) and content, (such as documentary forms, subject matter, administrative processes) of the unit of description, appropriate to the level of description. (ISAD(G) 3.3.1. See also RAD 1.7D)

label.name: Archivist's Note
label.description: Record notes on sources consulted in preparing the description and who prepared it. (ISAD(G) 3.7.1)

label.name: Rules or Conventions
label.description: Record the international, national and/or local rules or conventions followed in preparing the description. (ISAD(G) 3.7.2)

label.name: Note: Caption, signatures and inscriptions
label.description: Transcribe a caption, heading, or motto if different from the title recorded in the title and statement of responsibility area. Also record any signatures or inscriptions and where they appear. Example: Inscribed in pencil on upper right corner of front endpaper: R.S. Cassels, Xmas 1894, Toronto. (RAD 4.8B5 and 4.8B7)

label.name: Note: Signatures and inscriptions
label.description: Example: Inscribed in pencil on upper right corner of front endpaper: R.S. Cassels, Xmas 1894, Toronto. Inscribed in pencil on upper right corner of front endpaper: R.S. Cassels, Xmas 1894, Toronto OR Signed by the author.

label.name: Statement of Scale (Cartographic)
label.description: Example.: Scale 1:10 000.

label.name: Statement of Projection (Cartographic)
label.description: Example: Universal Transverse Mercator Proj.

label.name: Statement of Coordinates (Cartographic)
label.description: Example: 51° 28' 38" N etc.

label.name: Statement of Scale (Architectural)
label.description: Example: Scale 1/4" = 10 ft.

label.name: Issuing Jurisdiction and Denomination (Philatelic)
label.description: Example: Canada.

label.name: Denomination (Philatelic)
label.description: Example: Newfoundland : 5 pence.

label.name: Edition Statement
label.description: Look for terms like edition, issue or version (or their equivalents in other languages) e.g. 2nd ed.

label.name: Reference to Published Descriptions.
label.description: Provide a citation for publications in which the archival item has appeared.

label.name: Date(s) of Description(s)
label.description: Record the date(s) the entry was prepared and/or revised. (ISAD(G) 3.7.3)

label.name: Extent (Original)
label.description:
The extent (size or duration) of the original object. Also include medium of original. Example: 1 photograph: black and white
1 poster: colour, print; 46 x 32 cm

label.name: Resource Type
label.description: The nature of the content of the resource. Example: Still image Moving image Sound Text etc.

label.name: Type
label.description: La nature ou le genre de la ressource. (A compléter si des types additionnels doivent être saisis en plus du type de l'objet)

label.name: Source
label.description: A source from which the resource at hand was excerpted or derived. The described resource may be derived from the related resource in whole or in part. Example: Excerpted from: 30 minute audio cassette recording of Galway Kinnell, reading from his poems, at Southern Connecticut State

label.name: Notes
label.description: Front-facing note field.

label.name: Project Website
label.description: Link to the exhibition or project website. Example: http://www.enemyaliens.ca/

label.name: Institution
label.description: Name of the organization or unit that holds the original resource or digital surrogates of the resource. Example: Vancouver Holocaust Education Centre

label.name: Georeference
label.description: Coordinates documenting the location of the item

label.name: Description
label.description: Use to provide a brief synopsis of the document, image, or object. May include an abstract, table of contents, description of style, materials, and/or techniques used, brief delineation of the historical context of the object, and/or a few points concerning the significance of the resource. Use for short transcriptions. Example: Depicts unknown automobile driver stopping at roadside to add water to engine on all-day drive from Chico to Sacramento. Exact location unknown. Verso stamped with 596; manuscript note indicates car owned by “N.E.R.” (NCSU)

label.name: Transcript
label.description: Searchable text, created either by transcribing hand-written materials or by using OCR with a PDF file. Use the Description field for short transcriptions e.g. from the verso of a photograph

label.name: Date Created (Digital)
label.description: Creation date for the digital resource (born digital or digital surrogate). Example: 2015-01-20 (Date photograph taken: 15 August, 1945; digitized 20 January 2015)

label.name: Date Available
label.description: Date the digital resource was made or will be made available (copyright secured). Example: 2015-02-27

label.name: Format (Digital)
label.description: Format of digitized object or born-digital object.

label.name: Format (Digital)
label.description: The file format of the resource.

label.name: Format Notes
label.description: Further notes on the file format, physical medium, or dimensions of the resource.

label.name: Length
label.description: Length of object; enter in your preferred units (eg. 10cm)

label.name: Width
label.description: Width of object; enter in your preferred units (eg. 10cm)

label.name: Height
label.description: Height of object; enter in your preferred units (eg. 10cm)

label.name: Thickness
label.description: Thickness of object; enter in your preferred units (eg. 10cm)

label.name: Weight
label.description: Weight of object; enter in your preferred units

label.name: Provenance
label.description: A statement of any changes in ownership and custody of the resource since its creation that is significant for its authenticity, integrity and interpretation.

label.name: Notes – Administrative
label.description: Notes about the original or digital resource – notes that are for administrative purposes and are not descriptions of the object.

label.name: Publisher (Original)
label.description: An entity responsible for making available the original resource. (For born digital, use Publisher Dig.) Example: University of Virginia Press

label.name: Publisher (Digital)
label.description: An entity responsible for making the digital resource available publicly. Example: Vancouver Holocaust Education Centre

label.name: Collection
label.description: Free text box for Collection note

label.name: Digitized or Born Digital?
label.description: Choose one based on the resource.

label.name: License
label.description: The terms under which VHEC licenses digital resources to other institutions for particular purposes.

label.name: Rights
label.description: Information about rights held in and over the resource. Example: Reproduction and use of this material requires permission from the Vancouver Holocaust Education Centre.

label.name: Rights for Resource
label.description: Information about rights regarding the image or other resource. Use this sub-element if the holder of the reproduction rights for the image/resource differs from the holder of rights for the work. See also Rights Work above.

label.name: Physical Access Provisions
label.description: Arrangements required for physical access. Examples: Kept in remote storage; access requires 24 hours advance notice; Written permission required; Access by appointment only.

label.name: Use Rights: Terms Governing Use and Reproduction
label.description: Information on legal or donor restrictions that may affect use or reproduction of the material. No reproduction without prior written approval of the donor

label.name: Use Rights: Terms Governing Publication
label.description: Information on legal or donor restrictions that may affect publication of the material. Use of photographs in publication cannot be made without written permission of Kenneth McAllister

label.name: Notes: Rights and Access
label.description: Additional private notes pertinent to information in this category.

label.name: Conditions Governing Access
label.description: Specify the law or legal status, contract, regulation or policy that affects access to the unit of description. Indicate the extent of the period of closure and the date at which the material will open when appropriate. (ISAD(G) 3.4.1. See also RAD 1.8B16a)

label.name: ISBN
label.description: Library: 020a. Example: 0491001304

label.name: ISSN
label.description: Library: 022a. Example: $a 0376-4583.

label.name: Local Call Number
label.description: Library: 090a

label.name: Medium
label.description: Library: 245h

label.name: Edition Statement
label.description: Library: 250a

label.name: Place of Publication and Name of Publisher
label.description: Library: 264ab

label.name: Date of Publication
label.description: Library: 264c

label.name: Place of Distribution and Name of Distributor
label.description: Library: 264ab

label.name: Name of Distributor
label.description: Library: 264b

label.name: Copyright Date
label.description: Library: 264c

label.name: Physical Description
label.description: 300abc: extent, other details, dimensions e.g. 48 pages : illustrations (some colour), maps ; 27 cm.

label.name: Accompanying Material
label.description: Library: 300e

label.name: General Note
label.description: Library: 500a

label.name: Formatted Contents Note
label.description: Library: 505a

label.name: Summary
label.description: Library: 520a

label.name: Target Audience
label.description: Library: 521a

label.name: Public Recognition
label.description: Library: 541a

label.name: Method of Acquisition
label.description: Library: 541c

label.name: Date of Acquisition
label.description: Library: 541c

label.name: Dedication
label.description: Library: 541z

label.name: Administrative Note (Non-Display)
label.description: Library: 590a

label.name: Electronic Location and Access
label.description: Library: 856u

label.name: Electronic Location and Access: Non-Public Note
label.description: Library: 856x

label.name: Electronic Location and Access: Public Note
label.description: Library: 856z

label.name: Series Statement
label.description: Library: 490a

label.name: Volume/Sequential Designation
label.description: Library: 490v

label.name: Language
label.description: Library: 546a

label.name: Carrier Type
label.description: Library: 338

label.name: Statement of Responsibility
label.description: MARC 245c. RDA 2.4. Transcribe the statement of responsibility in the form in which it appears from anywhere on the resource. Only a statement of responsibility taken from outside of the resource itself should be enclosed in square brackets.

label.name: Interview Date(s)
label.description: Example: February 4 and February 18, 1987

label.name: Place of Recording
label.description: Example: Vancouver, B.C.: Survivor's home

label.name: Project
label.description: The project or grant under which the recording of the testimony was undertaken.

label.name: Identifying Markings
label.description: Markings on the support or imbedded in the medium that can be used to identify the copy of the described materials

label.name: Volume
label.description: Example: vol. 1

label.name: Part
label.description: Example: pt. 1

label.name: Number of copies
label.description: Example: 3 copies

label.name: Original Number
label.description: Local field

label.name: Image View Description
label.description: A description of the context (lighting) and/or aspect (position, angle, range, orientation, extent, or portion) or the work depicted in the image. Example: profile view, detail of lower left hand corner (CDWA)

label.name: Digitization Project
label.description: The name of the project or grant under which digitization took place.

label.name: Notes on Digitization Process
label.description: Any applicable notes regarding selection, conditions around digitization etc. (VHEC).

label.name: Digital File Notes
label.description: Notes about any edits made to the access copy of the surrogate (e.g. cropped to remove border, colour adjusted etc.) ; any artefacts discovered during QC (e.g. ghosting etc.) (VHEC).

label.name: Dates Associated with Name
label.description: Library: 100d

settings.setting: Automatically assigned alphanumeric identifier for this record.
Set to the current state of the object record.
Assign a unique VHEC barcode except in the rare instances where one is not required.
MARC 020a. RDA 2.15. Enter ISBNs with no hyphens or spaces. Example: 9781610694858
MARC 090a. Assign a local call number.

MARC 100ae. RDA 19.2, 19.3, 9.2.2, 18.5. Enter the creator having principal responsibility for the work. If principal responsibility is not indicated, enter only the first-named creator here and add others to 7XX. Ensure that the form of the name entered agrees with the VHEC's preferred name authorities. Select at least one role for the creator. Note: Compilers should be entered here, but editors (including editors of a compilation) should be entered exclusively in 7XX. Add relevant dates (e.g. birth) to the entity record.
Creators & Contributors - Corporate or Meeting Name
Creators & Contributors - Corporate or Meeting Name

MARC 110/111ae. RDA 19.2, 19.3, 11.2.2, 18.5. Enter the corporate body (includes meetings) having principal responsibility for the work. If principal responsibility is not indicated, enter only the first-named creator here and add others to 7XX. Ensure that the form of the name entered agrees with the VHEC's preferred name authorities. Select at least one role for the creator. Note: Compilers should be entered here, but editors (including editors of a compilation) should be entered exclusively in 7XX.

MARC 245ab. RDA 2.3.2, 2.3.3, 2.3.4. Transcribe the title as it appears on the preferred source of information ("record what you see"), following the VHEC Collections style manual guidelines. If you need to supply a title, put it in square brackets. For resources with an ISSN, enter the key title assigned to the resource by an ISSN registration agency.
MARC 246ab. RDA 2.3.8. Record variant (including parallel) titles that are considered important for identification or access. Select the type of title from the list.
MARC 250a. RDA 2.5.2, 2.5.6. Transcribe an edition statement as it appears on the source of information. Do not abbreviate; do not convert words to numbers, or numbers to words.
MARC 852b. If applicable, select the sub-collection.
MARC 856u. RDA 4.6. Enter a reliable URL in this field if the work can be found online.
MARC 856z. Enter public notes related to the access URL.
MARC 856x. Enter non-public notes related to the access URL.

For resources that have been discarded from the library collection, check the box and enter the discard date. Leave the Type set to None. Enter relevant notes about the discard (e.g. where it went, reason for discarding, etc.)
Automatically assigned alphanumeric identifier for this record.
Set to the current state of the object record.
Assign a unique VHEC barcode except in the rare instances where one is not required.
MARC 020a. RDA 2.15. Enter ISBNs with no hyphens or spaces. Example: 9781610694858
MARC 090a. Assign a local call number.

MARC 100ae. RDA 19.2, 19.3, 9.2.2, 18.5. Enter the creator having principal responsibility for the work. If principal responsibility is not indicated, enter only the first-named creator here and add others to 7XX. Ensure that the form of the name entered agrees with the VHEC's preferred name authorities. Select at least one role for the creator. Note: Compilers should be entered here, but editors (including editors of a compilation) should be entered exclusively in 7XX. Add relevant dates (e.g. birth) to the entity record.
Creators & Contributors - Corporate or Meeting Name
Creators & Contributors - Corporate or Meeting Name

MARC 110/111ae. RDA 19.2, 19.3, 11.2.2, 18.5. Enter the corporate body (includes meetings) having principal responsibility for the work. If principal responsibility is not indicated, enter only the first-named creator here and add others to 7XX. Ensure that the form of the name entered agrees with the VHEC's preferred name authorities. Select at least one role for the creator. Note: Compilers should be entered here, but editors (including editors of a compilation) should be entered exclusively in 7XX.

MARC 245ab. RDA 2.3.2, 2.3.3, 2.3.4. Transcribe the title as it appears on the preferred source of information ("record what you see"), following the VHEC Collections style manual guidelines. If you need to supply a title, put it in square brackets. For resources with an ISSN, enter the key title assigned to the resource by an ISSN registration agency. Add volume and/or copy information in square brackets at the end of the title.
MARC 246ab. RDA 2.3.8. Record variant (including parallel) titles that are considered important for identification or access. Select the type of title from the list.
MARC 250a. RDA 2.5.2, 2.5.6. Transcribe an edition statement as it appears on the source of information. Do not abbreviate; do not convert words to numbers, or numbers to words.
MARC 852b. If applicable, select the sub-collection.
MARC 856u. RDA 4.6. Enter a reliable URL in this field if the work can be found online.
MARC 856z. Enter public notes related to the access URL.
MARC 856x. Enter non-public notes related to the access URL.

For resources that have been discarded from the library collection, check the box and enter the discard date. Leave the Type set to None. Enter relevant notes about the discard (e.g. where it went, reason for discarding, etc.)

MARC 264ab. Place of Publication: RDA 2.8.2. Only the first-named place of publication is required. Transcribe places of publication in the form in which they appear on the resource. Transcribe the larger jurisdiction if it appears on the resource; if it does not appear, you may add it if you think it is helpful. Supplying a place of publication is preferable to recording [Place of publication not identified]. Name of Publisher: RDA 2.8.4. Only the first-named publisher is required. Transcribe the publisher's name as it appears on the resource; do not omit words, initials, statements of function, or levels of hierarchy; do not abbreviate terms. Enter [Publisher not identified] where the publisher's name is not available.

MARC 264c. RDA 2.8.6. Enter the date of publication. Supplying a date of publication is preferable to recording [Date of publication not identified], but the field may be left empty if a copyright date will be recorded separately.
MARC 264c. RDA 2.11. Enter a copyright date if one is given on the resource. Example: ©2009
Enter the date that best represents the resource if you were to place the resource on a timeline. Example: 1993

MARC 300abce. RDA 3.4, 7.22, 3.11, 3.5. Enter the extent, other physical details, dimensions and information about accompanying material. Do not use abbreviations for terms with the exception of measurements, including cm, min., sec., etc. Record "unnumbered" rather than square brackets enclosing the numeral (e.g. 16 unnumbered pages of plates).

MARC 300abce. RDA 3.4, 7.22, 3.11, 3.5. Enter the extent, other physical details, dimensions and information about accompanying material. Do not use abbreviations for terms with the exception of measurements, including cm, min., sec., etc. Record "unnumbered" rather than square brackets enclosing the numeral (e.g. 16 unnumbered pages of plates).
MARC 338a. RDA 3.3. Select the carrier type.
Enter additional notes about the carrier type, if required.
MARC 655. Select the genre, if applicable.

MARC 490av. RDA 2.12.2, 2.12.10, 2.12.9, 2.12.17. For resources that belong to a series, enter the series name and the volume/sequential designation of the resource. Often, there will be no volume/sequential designation. Example: Studies in immigration and culture ; 14

MARC 264ab. Place of Publication: RDA 2.8.2. Only the first-named place of publication is required. Transcribe places of publication in the form in which they appear on the resource. Transcribe the larger jurisdiction if it appears on the resource; if it does not appear, you may add it if you think it is helpful. Supplying a place of publication is preferable to recording [Place of publication not identified]. Name of Publisher: RDA 2.8.4. Only the first-named publisher is required. Transcribe the publisher's name as it appears on the resource; do not omit words, initials, statements of function, or levels of hierarchy; do not abbreviate terms. Enter [Publisher not identified] where the publisher's name is not available.

MARC 264c. RDA 2.8.6. Enter the date of publication. Supplying a date of publication is preferable to recording [Date of publication not identified], but the field may be left empty if a copyright date will be recorded separately.
MARC 264c. RDA 2.11. Enter a copyright date if one is given on the resource. Example: ©2009

MARC 300abce. RDA 3.4, 7.22, 3.11, 3.5. Enter the extent, other physical details, dimensions and information about accompanying material. Do not use abbreviations for terms with the exception of measurements, including cm, min., sec., etc. Record "unnumbered" rather than square brackets enclosing the numeral (e.g. 16 unnumbered pages of plates).

MARC 300abce. RDA 3.4, 7.22, 3.11, 3.5. Enter the extent, other physical details, dimensions and information about accompanying material. Do not use abbreviations for terms with the exception of measurements, including cm, min., sec., etc. Record "unnumbered" rather than square brackets enclosing the numeral (e.g. 16 unnumbered pages of plates).
MARC 338a. RDA 3.3. Select the carrier type.
Enter additional notes about the carrier type, if required.
MARC 655. Select the genre, if applicable.

MARC 500a. Enter general information, relevant for the public, for which a specialized 5XX or other field has not been defined. This field will be most commonly used for the following MARC note fields: 500 (General Note), 502 (Dissertation Note), 504 (Bibliography, etc. Note) and 586 (Awards Note).
MARC 505a. Enter titles of separate works or parts of an item or the table of contents. This field may also contain statements of responsibility and volume numbers or other sequential designations.
MARC 520a. RDA 7.2, 7.10. Enter a summary, abstract, annotation or phrase describing the material.

MARC 521a. RDA 7.7. This field is normally only used for material in the Beginner Reader, Children's and Young Adult sections and for items commonly used by or intended for educators. Enter information that identifies the specific audience (usually by age and/or grade level) for which the content of the item is considered appropriate. Example: Grade 8 and above
MARC 541c. RDA 2.19. Enter the method of acquisition for the item. The most common terms will be Gift or Purchase, but additional information may be added.
MARC 541c. RDA 2.19. Enter the item's date of acquisition.
MARC 541a. RDA 2.19. Enter the name of the donor.

MARC 541a. RDA 2.19. Enter the full public recognition for the donation. In many cases, this will be the same as the text that appears on the donation label. Example: Gift of Janet Simpson in honour of Jack Smith, 2014.
MARC 541z. Enter the dedication information. Example: In honour of Jack Smith
MARC 546a. RDA 6.11, 7.12. Select the language(s) of the resource.
Enter additional notes about the language(s), if required.
MARC 590a. Enter notes about the resource that are administrative and not intended for display.
If the resource was previously catalogued in Filemaker Pro, enter the Filemaker Pro cataloguing (record) date.

MARC 500a. Enter general information, relevant for the public, for which a specialized 5XX or other field has not been defined. This field will be most commonly used for the following MARC note fields: 500 (General Note), 502 (Dissertation Note), 504 (Bibliography, etc. Note) and 586 (Awards Note).
MARC 505a. Enter titles of separate works or parts of an item or the table of contents. This field may also contain statements of responsibility and volume numbers or other sequential designations.
MARC 520a. RDA 7.2, 7.10. Enter a summary, abstract, annotation or phrase describing the material.

MARC 521a. RDA 7.7. This field is normally only used for material in the Beginner Reader, Children's and Young Adult sections and for items commonly used by or intended for educators. Enter information that identifies the specific audience (usually by age and/or grade level) for which the content of the item is considered appropriate. Example: Grade 8 and above
MARC 541c. RDA 2.19. Enter the method of acquisition for the item. The most common terms will be Gift or Purchase, but additional information may be added.
MARC 541c. RDA 2.19. Enter the item's date of acquisition.
MARC 541a. RDA 2.19. Enter the name of the donor.

MARC 541a. RDA 2.19. Enter the full public recognition for the donation. In many cases, this will be the same as the text that appears on the donation label. Example: Gift of Janet Simpson in honour of Jack Smith, 2014.
MARC 541z. Enter the dedication information. Example: In honour of Jack Smith
MARC 546a. RDA 6.11, 7.12. Select the language(s) of the resource.
Enter additional notes about the language(s), if required.
MARC 590a. Enter notes about the resource that are administrative and not intended for display.
If the resource was previously catalogued in Filemaker Pro, enter the Filemaker Pro cataloguing (record) date.
MARC 6XX. Enter Library of Congress Subject Headings. Example: Holocaust survivors -- Canada -- Biography.
MARC 600/610/611. Add entities (individual, organization/meeting, family) who are the subject of the resource.
MARC 690. Select subject headings from the locally-developed thesaurus.
Enter subject keywords in this field if you cannot find a suitable term in the Local Subject Headings thesaurus. These keywords will be used to suggest new terms for the thesaurus.
Enter the coordinates for the location(s) associated with the resource.
Information about rights held in and over the resource. Example: Reproduction and use of this material requires permission from the Vancouver Holocaust Education Centre.

Use this field if the holder of the reproduction rights for the image/resource differs from the holder of rights for the work. Example: The work rights are “© National Museum of African Art, Smithsonian Institution (Washington DC),” but the image rights are “Photo © Frank Khoury.”
A person or organization owning or managing rights over the resource. Examples from CDWA: Warhol Foundation; Sternfeld, Joel; Museum of Modern Art
The terms under which VHEC licenses digital resources to other institutions or under which other institutions loan items to VHEC.

Information about who can access the resource or an indication of its security status. Examples from MARC: Access copy available to the general public; Access available to account holders only; Some restrictions apply.
Enter the coordinates for the location(s) associated with the resource.
Related Archival Items, Museum Works, and Survivor Testimonies
Related Archival Items, Museum Works, and Survivor Testimonies
A unique alphanumeric identifier for this object. (CA)
A unique identifier for museum objects represented by a barcode. (VHEC)
Set to the current state of the object record.

Titles, identifying phrases, or names given to a work of art, architecture, or material culture. For complex works, series, or collections, the title may refer to a discrete unit within the larger entity (a print from a series) or it may identify only the larger entity. Example: Pot with lid. (CDWA)

The name, anonymous individuals or corporate bodies responsible for the design, production, manufacture, or alteration of the work, presented in a syntax suitable for display to the end-user and including any necessary indications of uncertainty, ambiguity, and nuance. (Modified CDWA)

The names, appellations, or other identifiers assigned to an individual, group of people or other entity that has contributed to the design, creation, production, manufacture, or alteration of the work. Name authority, from which the names, nationality, and dates may be derived, is recommended. (CCO A1: Personal and Corporate Name Authority).

Information about the dimensions, size, or scale of the work, presernted in a syntax suitable for display to the end-user and including any necessary indications of uncertainty, ambiguity, and nuance. It may also include the number of parts of a complex work, series, or collection. Example: 61.6 x 97.2cm (24 1/4 x 36 1/4 inches) (oval); scale: 1 inch = 10 feet. (CDWA)
The dimensions or other measurements for one aspect of a work (e.g., width); may be combined with extent, qualifier and other sub-elements as necessary. Use the metric system. (CDWA lite)

An indication of the substances or materials used in the creation of a work, as well as any implements, production or manufacturing techniques incorporated in its fabrication, presented in a syntax suitable for display to the end-user and including any necessary indications of uncertainty, ambiguity, and nuance. For works on paper, descriptions of watermarks may also be included. (For marks applied to the work or support by the artist or subsequently by another person, see INSCRIPTIONS.) Example: gelatin silverprint. (Modified CDWA)

Materials and techniques indexed with controlled terms for retrieval; if multiple parts of the work require separate materials and techniques, processes or methods, or if you are recording medi/ and support separately, repeat this element with the type attribute and/or the extent sub-element. (CDWA lite)

The relationship of a work created in multiples, such as a print, to other stages of the same work or a description of the specific edition to which a work belongs, whether expressed as a fractional number or as a name or expression of the context related to prior or later issuances. Example: State: 1st of 3 states (Robison (1986)); Edition: 2nd Edition. (CCO)

Placement of a work of art or architecture within a classification scheme that groups other, similar works together on the basis of similar characteristics including: materials, form, shape, function, region of origin, cultural context, or historical or stylistic era. Example: Identity cards. (CDWA)

This category deals with any named, defined style, historical or artistic period, movement, group, or school whose characteristics are represented in the work being cataloged. Example: Art-Nouveau, Dutch. (CDWA)
Name of the culture, people, or nationality from which the work originated. Example: French, Dutch. (CDWA)

A concise description of the date or range of dates associated with the creation, design, production, presentation, performance, construction, or alteration of the work or its components, presented in a syntax suitable for display to the end-user and including any necessary indications of uncertainty, ambiguity, and nuance. Example: ca. 1939, Before 1945. (CDWA)
A set of years in the calendar delimiting the span of time during which the creation and the production fo the work took place. (CA)

The location where the creation, design, or production of the work or its components took place, or the original location of the work. Example: Amsterdam (Netherlands), "Camp Q" (Monteith, Ontario, Canada).
A clarification of the significance of the place or location, including an indication that different creative activities took place at different locations. Example: design, publication. (CDWA)
Enter the coordinates for the location(s) associated with the resource.
Storage location within the VHEC holdings. (VHEC)
An identification or link to a repository (corporate body) or geographic place where the work is currently or was formerly located. Example: Vancouver Holocaust Education Centre. (CDWA)
Controlled Indexing terms that characterize in general terms what the work depicts or what is depicted in it. (CDWA)

A description of distinguishing or identifying physical markings, lettering, annotations, texts, or labels that are a part of a work or are affixed, applied, stamped, written, inscribed, or attached to the work, excluding any mark or text inherent in materials. Example: Photograph signed on verso (Modified CDWA)

A detailed discussion of the way in which the work was made, including an assessment of its workmanship or characteristics of execution, the construction methods used, or the specific applications of techniques. Example: The box was made by an unknown internee from birch bark and was assembled by hand and the covered in fabric to replicate the uniform they were forced to wear. (Modified CDWA)
An explanation of the way a work is meant to be seen or has been displayed. Example: Displayed horizontally. (CDWA)
Language or languages of the content of the work. Example: German, English, Yiddish. (CA)
Descriptive note relating to the langauge or languages of the work. Example: Printed text in Dutch, handwritten note in German. (VHEC)
Online content related to the work. This could include links to other repositories that have one item in a series of items. (VHEC)
A descriptive note contextualizing any associated materials. (VHEC)
Legacy data from pervious VHEC numbering schemata. (VHEC)
A unique alphanumeric identifier for this object. (CA)
A unique identifier for museum objects represented by a barcode. (VHEC)

"Titles, identifying phrases, or names given to a work of art, architecture, or material culture. For complex works, series, or collections, the title may refer to a discrete unit within the larger entity (a print from a series) or it may identify only the larger entity. Example: Pot with lid. (CDWA)"

The name, anonymous individuals or corporate bodies responsible for the design, production, manufacture, or alteration of the work, presented in a syntax suitable for display to the end-user and including any necessary indications of uncertainty, ambiguity, and nuance. (Modified CDWA)

The names, appellations, or other identifiers assigned to an individual, group of people or other entity that has contributed to the design, creation, production, manufacture, or alteration of the work. Name authority, from which the names, nationality, and dates may be derived, is recommended. (CCO A1: Personal and Corporate Name Authority).

Information about the dimensions, size, or scale of the work, presernted in a syntax suitable for display to the end-user and including any necessary indications of uncertainty, ambiguity, and nuance. It may also include the number of parts of a complex work, series, or collection. Example: 61.6 x 97.2cm (24 1/4 x 36 1/4 inches) (oval); scale: 1 inch = 10 feet. (CDWA)
The dimensions or other measurements for one aspect of a work (e.g., width); may be combined with extent, qualifier and other sub-elements as necessary. Use the metric system. (CDWA lite)

An indication of the substances or materials used in the creation of a work, as well as any implements, production or manufacturing techniques incorporated in its fabrication, presented in a syntax suitable for display to the end-user and including any necessary indications of uncertainty, ambiguity, and nuance. For works on paper, descriptions of watermarks may also be included. (For marks applied to the work or support by the artist or subsequently by another person, see INSCRIPTIONS.) Example: gelatin silverprint. (Modified CDWA)

Materials and techniques indexed with controlled terms for retrieval; if multiple parts of the work require separate materials and techniques, processes or methods, or if you are recording medi/ and support separately, repeat this element with the type attribute and/or the extent sub-element. (CDWA lite)

The relationship of a work created in multiples, such as a print, to other stages of the same work or a description of the specific edition to which a work belongs, whether expressed as a fractional number or as a name or expression of the context related to prior or later issuances. Example: State: 1st of 3 states (Robison (1986)); Edition: 2nd Edition. (CCO)

Placement of a work of art or architecture within a classification scheme that groups other, similar works together on the basis of similar characteristics including: materials, form, shape, function, region of origin, cultural context, or historical or stylistic era. Example: Identity cards. (CDWA)

This category deals with any named, defined style, historical or artistic period, movement, group, or school whose characteristics are represented in the work being cataloged. Example: Art-Nouveau, Dutch. (CDWA)
Name of the culture, people, or nationality from which the work originated. Example: French, Dutch. (CDWA)

A concise description of the date or range of dates associated with the creation, design, production, presentation, performance, construction, or alteration of the work or its components, presented in a syntax suitable for display to the end-user and including any necessary indications of uncertainty, ambiguity, and nuance. Example: ca. 1939, Before 1945. (CDWA)
A set of years in the calendar delimiting the span of time during which the creation and the production fo the work took place. (CA)

The location where the creation, design, or production of the work or its components took place, or the original location of the work. Example: Amsterdam (Netherlands), "Camp Q" (Monteith, Ontario, Canada).
A clarification of the significance of the place or location, including an indication that different creative activities took place at different locations. Example: design, publication. (CDWA)
Storage location within the VHEC holdings. (VHEC)
An identification or link to a repository (corporate body) or geographic place where the work is currently or was formerly located. Example: Vancouver Holocaust Education Centre. (CDWA)
Controlled Indexing terms that characterize in general terms what the work depicts or what is depicted in it. (CDWA)

A description of distinguishing or identifying physical markings, lettering, annotations, texts, or labels that are a part of a work or are affixed, applied, stamped, written, inscribed, or attached to the work, excluding any mark or text inherent in materials. Example: Photograph signed on verso (Modified CDWA)

A detailed discussion of the way in which the work was made, including an assessment of its workmanship or characteristics of execution, the construction methods used, or the specific applications of techniques. Example: The box was made by an unknown internee from birch bark and was assembled by hand and the covered in fabric to replicate the uniform they were forced to wear. (Modified CDWA)
An explanation of the way a work is meant to be seen or has been displayed. Example: Displayed horizontally. (CDWA)
Language or languages of the content of the work. Example: German, English, Yiddish. (CA)
Descriptive note relating to the langauge or languages of the work. Example: Printed text in Dutch, handwritten note in German. (VHEC)
Online content related to the work. This could include links to other repositories that have one item in a series of items. (VHEC)
A descriptive note contextualizing any associated materials. (VHEC)
Legacy data from pervious VHEC numbering schemata. (VHEC)
Information about who can access the resource. Example: Access available to the general public, access restricted. (Modified DC)

Use this field if the holder of the reproduction rights for the image/resource differs from the holder of rights for the work. Example: The reproduction rights are "Library and Archives Canada" but the images rights are "Photo ©Yousuf Karsh." (Modified CDWA lite)
A person or organization owning or manging rights over the resource. Example: Library and Archives Canada. (DC)
The terms under which the VHEC licenses digital resources to other institutions or underwhich other insititutions loan items to the VHEC. (Modified DC)

Specify the law or legal status contract, regulation or policy that affects access to the unit of description. Indicate the extent of the period of closure and the date at which the material will open when appropriate. (ISAD(G) 3.4.1 See also RAD 1.8B16a).
Information about who can access the resource or an indication of its security status. (DC)

Details arrangements required for physical to the object. Examples: Kept in remote storage; Access requires 24 hours advance notice; Written permission required; Access by appointment only. (MARC 506c)
Information on legal or donor restrictions that may affect use of reproduction of the material. (RAD 1.8B16c)

Information on legal or donor restrictions that may affect publication of the material. Example: Use of photographs in publication cannot be made without written permision of Kennith McAllister. (RAD 1.8B16d)
Additional notes or comments pertinent to information in this category. (VHEC)

A term describing the nature of the relationship between the work at hand and related entity

A term describing the nature of the relationship between the work at hand and related entity
The unique alphanumberic identifier for this object (CA)
First letter of last name, followed by full first name e.g. S., Bronia
Note about language(s) used during recording. Example: In Hungarian with English subtitles.
The time-coded narrative of the testimony.
Example: There are some technical problems with the video portion of this testimony.
A short descriptive summary of the testimony.

The unique alphanumberic identifier for this object (CA)
Carrier type or format of instantiation
Information transcribed from the physical medium used to identify and/or distinguish the material
Example: There are some technical problems with the video portion of this testimony.
Information about rights held in and over the resource. Example: Reproduction and use of this material requires permission from the Vancouver Holocaust Education Centre.

Use this field if the holder of the reproduction rights for the image/resource differs from the holder of rights for the work. Example: The work rights are “© National Museum of African Art, Smithsonian Institution (Washington DC),” but the image rights are “Photo © Frank Khoury.”
A person or organization owning or managing rights over the resource. Examples from CDWA: Warhol Foundation; Sternfeld, Joel; Museum of Modern Art
The terms under which VHEC licenses digital resources to other institutions or under which other institutions loan items to VHEC.

Information about who can access the resource or an indication of its security status. Examples from MARC: Access copy available to the general public; Access available to account holders only; Some restrictions apply.
Provide either a formal title or a supplied title appropriate to the unit of description. Example: Adele Wiseman fonds. (ISAD(G) 3.1.2. See also RAD 1.1B)

Use only if the title appears in two or more languages on the item; follow the order in which the titles appear. Example: International map of natural gas fields in Europe [GMD] = Carte internationale des champs de gaz naturel en Europe
Record the date(s) of creation or accumulation of the unit of description as a single date or a range of dates. (ISAD(G) 3.1.3. See also RAD 1.4B)
Date(s) of creation for the unit, either as a single date or a range of dates.
Location within VHEC. Example: Box: J-2. VHEC Archives. File Cabinet/Drawer: FC 1/3
Record the name of the organization(s) or the individual(s) responsible for the creation, accumulation and maintenance of the records in the unit of description. (ISAD(G) 3.2.1)
Information about rights held in and over the resource. Example: Reproduction and use of this material requires permission from the Vancouver Holocaust Education Centre.

The title or name of the exhibition. Example: "Degenerate Art": The Fate of the Avant-Garde in Nazi Germany
The name or names of those responsible for the intellectual content of the exhibition, including the selection of works and their interpretation. Example: DeGrazia, Diane

A display of the names, locations, and dates where the exhibition or work was on public view. Example: Los Angeles County Museum of Art, 30 September-23 November 1975; St. Louis Museum, 16 March-9 May 1976.

Select the type of the unit of description.
Select the type of the unit of description.
An unambiguous reference to the digital resource autogenerated by CollectiveAccess.
Identifier given to resource by VHEC.
The name of the resource or the name given to the resource. Title may be same at item-level and/or could include "recto", "verso" etc.
Extent of the digitized object. (Original described at item-level) Extent may not be same as at item level if, for example, item is an excerpt or edited version.

Description of digitized object if different from item-level. Use field to describe different views, pages, segments of a/v material etc. Include short transciptions (e.g. from the verso of a photograph).
Date the digitized or born digital object is made available online by VHEC.
An entity responsible for making the digital resource available publicly. Example: Vancouver Holocaust Education Centre. For digitized objects made available online, VHEC is the digital publisher.
A source from which the resource at hand was excerpted or derived. The described resource may be derived from the related resource in whole or in part.
Notes about the digital resource that are for administrative purposes and are not descriptions of the object.
Name of project/grant that funded digitization, if applicable
Record any applicable notes regarding selection , conditions around digitization etc.
Notes about any edits made to the access copy of the surrogate (e.g. cropped to remove border, colour adjusted etc.); any artefacts discovered during QC (i.e. ghosting etc.)
Link to the exhibition or project website. Example: http://www.enemyaliens.ca/
Carrier type or format of instantiation (VHEC)
Example: There are some technical problems with the video portion of this testimony.
Information about rights held in and over the resource. Example: Reproduction and use of this material requires permission from the Vancouver Holocaust Education Centre.

Information about who can access the resource or an indication of its security status. Examples from MARC: Access copy available to the general public; Access available to account holders only; Some restrictions apply.
Record start and end time of annotated clip (hh:mm:ss).
The name of the institution to which the loan has been made.
The name of the person or agency responsible for the loan.
A display of the names, locations and dates of the loan.
